content:
Sure, here's an example of a female author from the 20th/21st century who discusses Plato's critique of writing:

1. Maryanne Wolf - Maryanne Wolf is a neuroscientist and psychologist who specializes in the study of reading and literacy. In her book "Proust and the Squid: The Story and Science of the Reading Brain", Wolf discusses Plato's critique of writing and its impact on the development of the human brain. She argues that reading and writing have changed the way humans think and process information, and that these changes have had a profound impact on the development of human consciousness.

Wolf's work provides a unique perspective on the impact of writing on the human brain and offers insights into the ways in which literacy has shaped human culture and thought.
